content.question: Religious revival movements of the eighteenth century such as Methodism and Pietism are best understood in the context of

choices.label: continuations of Protestant traditions of religious and social reform
reactions to attempts to reimpose Catholicism in Protestant areas
concerns over the immigration of non-Christians to Europe
a decrease in the importance of religion as a cause of international conflict

content.answer: continuations of Protestant traditions of religious and social reform

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
